comments:
3 NullPointerExceptions when clicking the browse button on the Save Conflict Dialog.

Steps to Produce:

Open up a local file from the Remote System's View.  Open up that file outside of eclipse and make some changes to it.  Save that file.  Go back to eclipse and make some changes to the file.  Press CTRL + S to save the file.  The Save Conflict dialog appears.

Click "Save the contents of the editor to a different remote file."  Click the Browse button.  2 Error Dialogs appear.

Error Log Details:

-----------Enter bugs above this line-----------
installation : Eclipse-SDK-3.3M6
RSE install  : 2.0M6
java.runtime : Sun 1.5.0_06-b05
os.name:     : Windows XP, Service Pack 2
------------------------------------------------

Error log for bug: https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=181304 deals with the same thing.  The getAbsoluteName() function of SystemViewFilterAdapter.  

May want to mark one of these as duplicate of the other.

Appears a similiar bug was opened, but for the getAbsoluteName() function of SystemViewFilterReferenceAdapter and was fixed for M6.  https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=181394
I've put in code to handle the absolute name when the filter is a SystemFilterSimple (a transient thing for this dialog).  That fixes the null pointer.
*** Bug 181304 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
